paretofront module¶

Original Developer: Jonathan Ward Purpose of Modules: To compute the 2d Pareto Front. Last Modified: 7/28/15 Last Modified By: Jonathan Ward Last Modification Purpose: To add comments.

class paretofront.ParetoFront(points, x_reverse, y_reverse)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes nested Pareto Frontiers of points in 2d.

Calculates the Convex Hull of the set of points using qhull, then computes the Pareto Front of those points.

build_nextfront()[source]¶

Build the Pareto front of the points with the last front removed

If the next front is successfully built return True, otherwise False. Since points array does not have duplicates, the pruned points array does not have duplicates.

fronts_indices = []¶
points_array = []¶
pruned_points_indices = []¶
static remove_duplicates(points_array)[source]¶

Gives the indices of the unique points.

remove_frontindices(front_indices_rel_points)[source]¶

Gives the indices of the points without the indices of the front.

static vertices_to_frontindices(vertices, x_reverse, y_reverse)[source]¶

Computes the Pareto front given the vertices of the convex hull.

If x_reverse is set to True then the Pareto front minimizes x-values. If y_reverse is set to True then the Pareto front minimizes y-values.

x_reverse = False¶
y_reverse = False¶
